title: Gauss law - cylinder with density beta r-cubed

content.question: A long insulating tube of length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> has inner radius <math alttext="r sub a" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi></msub></math> and outer radius <math alttext="r sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></math>, where <math alttext="L is much greater than r sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi><mo>≫</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></math>, as shown in the figure. The tube has a nonuniform charge distributed throughout its volume. The charge density <math alttext="rho" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ρ</mi></math> as a function of the distance <math alttext="r" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>r</mi></math> from the tube’s central axis is <math alttext="rho of r equals, beta times r cubed" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ρ</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>r</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>β</mi><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>3</mn></msup></math> for <math alttext="r sub a, less than r, less than r sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mi>r</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></math>, where <math alttext="beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>β</mi></math> is a positive constant. Ignoring edge effects, what is the electric field <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> in the range <math alttext="r sub a, less than r, less than r sub b" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mi>r</mi><mo><</mo><msub><mi>r</mi><mi>b</mi></msub></math> inside the tube?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction beta over 4 times epsilon sub 0, end sub, times r, end fraction, times open parenthesis, r to the fourth power, minus, r sub a, end sub, to the fourth power, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>β</mi><mrow><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>4</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mn>4</mn></msubsup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction beta over 5 times epsilon sub 0, end sub, times r, end fraction, times open parenthesis, r to the fifth power, minus, r sub a, end sub, to the fifth power, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>β</mi><mrow><mn>5</mn><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mn>5</mn></msubsup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the fraction beta over 5 times epsilon sub 0, end sub, times r, end fraction, times open parenthesis, r sub b, end sub, to the fifth power, minus, r to the fifth power, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>β</mi><mrow><mn>5</mn><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msubsup><mi>r</mi><mi>b</mi><mn>5</mn></msubsup><mo>−</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction beta over 5 times epsilon sub 0, end sub, times r, end fraction, times open parenthesis, r to the fifth power, minus, r sub a, end sub, to the fifth power, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mfrac><mi>β</mi><mrow><mn>5</mn><msub><mi>ε</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mi>r</mi></mrow></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mi>r</mi><mn>5</mn></msup><mo>−</mo><msubsup><mi>r</mi><mi>a</mi><mn>5</mn></msubsup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
